botanical_details.potentially_harmful: All parts may cause mild stomach upset if ingested, sap may irritate skin. Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Ficus can be evergreen or deciduous trees, shrubs or climbers, with often leathery, simple, entire or lobed leaves and tiny flowers borne within a hollow receptacle which enlarges to form the fruit

how_to_grow.cultivation: Water regulary in the growing season letting the top of the compost feel dry to touch before watering again. Mist leaves regulary to improve humidity. Place on a saucer with expanded clay granules or gravel keeping these damp but not sat in water. This will also increase humidity. Avoid sudden temperature drops and cold draughts
how_to_grow.propagation: Root semi-ripe cuttings or leaf bud cuttings with bottom heat in spring or late summer
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to red spidermite , thrips, mealy bugs and scale insects
